meanings.sent1: The old bridge was unsteady, making it unsafe to cross.
meanings.sent2: She felt unsteady on her feet after spinning around in circles.
meanings.sent3: The unsteady table leg caused the whole dinner to wobble comically.
meanings.sent4: His unsteady voice betrayed his nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The unsteady flame flickered in the wind, casting eerie shadows in the room.

meanings.sent1: The unsteady chair wobbled dangerously when sat upon.
meanings.sent2: The toddler's unsteady steps were adorable as he tried to walk on his own.
meanings.sent3: The unsteady stack of books teetered on the edge of the shelf, threatening to fall.
meanings.sent4: Her unsteady emotions made it difficult for her to make decisions.
meanings.sent5: The unsteady boat rocked back and forth on the choppy waves of the ocean.

meanings.definition: Moving or changing in an irregular or uncontrolled manner
meanings.sent1: The unsteady flame danced in the breeze, casting shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The unsteady weather made it hard to predict if it would rain or shine.
meanings.sent3: The unsteady performance of the actor kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her unsteady progress in learning the new dance routine frustrated her.
meanings.sent5: The unsteady stream meandered through the forest, changing its course with each rainfall.
